## Welcome to my website!

My name is Marlin Figgins.
I am a third-year PhD candidate in the [University of Washingtonâ€™s Department of Applied Mathematics](https://amath.washington.edu/people/marlin-figgins) as a Boeing, ARCS, and NSF GRFP fellow. 

I currently develop methods for modeling, Bayesian inference, and forecasting of epidemic and evolutionary dynamics of respiratory viruses in the [Bedford lab](https://bedford.io/) at the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center. You can learn more about this work on the [Research](research.qmd) page.

For further details on my professional life, you can view and download my CV in PDF format on this page.
